Setting permissions to view the change audit
By default, any user of the System is able to ''view the change history (
audit
) of the object''. It means that if you select an object, the View audit button
becomes active automatically (both in the
registry
, and in the
object profile
).
To hide the ability to view the audit, configure the
View audit
permission. To do this:
1. Choose the
Access to System objects
menu item (by default, sequentially: ''Administration â†’ Access to System objects'').
2. In the "Object type" field, select Permission.
3. Select the
View audit
permission to configure.
4. Select user/user group using the button
(if needed).
5. Set the permission to perform the actions using:
Read
(allow or restrict reading is enough to customize the display of the button
)
Write
Execute
Delete
6. Save changes using the button
.
